Anyone watch the cult hit series Firefly? No doubt you are all familiar with the summer sci-fi film serenity, based on the series? 
 
 Some more info on the series
 
 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefly_%28television_series%29
 
 A breif summary would say it is an interesting mix sci fi and western, but very character driven and with a slight American Civil War flavour. Very unusual, and very, very good. If you have not seen this already I strongly suggest giving it a try. The series has an unusual way of getting inside yourhead and taking over your mind.
Fantastics series! Wonderful writing, great acting, I loved it. Unfortunately, it didn't pidgeon hole well, so Fox canned it. The dopes. :(

Absolutely one of the best shows that has ever graced television. I was a fan from day one, and Fox's mishandling of the show was just another reason to hate them. I bought the series on dvd the week it was available, and I saw Serenity on opening day. 
 
 "I'm a leaf on the wind...watch how I soar."

Ok the scene in Jaynestown was only 30sec long wasn't that impressive. I did think the 26year old virgin was because he was gay but, I was only hoping, it wasn't the case. Now I have seen the first episode and the last. The last episode, Jaynestown, was even more of a western. I think that is why it failed western fans tend not to be scifi fans and vica versa.
